meanings.definition: Protection against possible loss or damage
meanings.sent1: Having insurance provides indemnification in case of accidents.
meanings.sent2: The warranty on the product offers indemnification for any defects.
meanings.sent3: She felt relieved knowing the indemnification would cover her expenses.
meanings.sent4: The umbrella acted as an indemnification against the sudden rainstorm.
meanings.sent5: The fortress walls served as a strong indemnification against enemy attacks.

meanings.sent1: The company offered financial indemnification to the injured worker.
meanings.sent2: He received indemnification for the damages caused by the accident.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected bonus felt like a sweet indemnification for his hard work.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was the best indemnification for his efforts.
meanings.sent5: The warm hug was a comforting indemnification after a long day.

meanings.definition: Legal exemption from penalties or liabilities
meanings.sent1: The contract included an indemnification clause to protect the company.
meanings.sent2: The lawyer ensured the indemnification of his client from any legal repercussions.
meanings.sent3: His lucky charm seemed to bring indemnification from trouble.
meanings.sent4: The magical amulet granted indemnification from evil spirits.
meanings.sent5: The shield symbolized indemnification from harm in ancient tales.
